page.title: 15Religion _ Leck area
page.content: People in our area largely belong to either the Methodist or Anglican churches. The people who live in the villages are usually Anglican whereas the outlying farms are Methodist. The Anglican churches can no longer support a vicar each and so several of the parishes have been amalgamated. Whittington, Arkholme, and Gressingham on the west side of the river Lune have joined together and Melling, Tunstall, and Leck will soon do the same. Congregations in the Anglican churches have fallen over the years whereas the Methodist church appears to retain its strength. Methodist farmers tend to send their children to the local small secondary school at Hornby where they spend five years before returning to work on the family farm.
